intro: Sanguisorba stipulata var. latifolia, commonly known as broad-leaved sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern Asia. It features upright, branched stems that bear clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped, serrated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
